body_html:
I don't fully understand the part out is treated as a view since the last operation is a viewing operation.
Does this mean that, as long as I have a viewing operation, any previous clone/detach would be ignored?

It is quite surprising that out.detach().transpose(-1,1) and out.transpose(-1,1).detach() would behave differently.
body_text:
I don't fully understand the part out is treated as a view since the last operation is a viewing operation.
Does this mean that, as long as I have a viewing operation, any previous clone/detach would be ignored?
It is quite surprising that out.detach().transpose(-1,1) and out.transpose(-1,1).detach() would behave differently.
body:
I don't fully understand the part `out` is treated as a view since the last operation is a viewing operation.
Does this mean that, as long as I have a viewing operation, any previous clone/detach would be ignored?

It is quite surprising that `out.detach().transpose(-1,1)` and `out.transpose(-1,1).detach()` would behave differently.
